description: The human parainfluenza virus (HPIV) is an enveloped, negative-sense, single-stranded RNA virus that belongs to the family of Paramyxoviridae. It is genetically and antigenically divided into four main serotypes, numbered as HPIV-1 to HPIV-4, with further subtypes of HPIV-4a and HPIV-4b.The human parainfluenza viruses 1 and 3 belong to the genus of Respirovirus, and the genus Rubulavirus includes HPIV-2 and 4.
name: Human Parainfluenza Viruses (HPIV) Antibodies and Antigens
